result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard J. Kendall

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Richard J. Kendall in court with attorney Gregory W. Sacra.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cover Letter from Court to the atty.'s

Defendant Richard J. Kendall in court with attorney Gregory W. Sacra.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Sacra gives status.  Defendant just returned from 3 day stay in hospital.  Medical issues.  Attorney Sacra provide medical information and letter from physician to State and court.  Defendant is fairly stable at this point.  Defendant understands the need for the evaluation.  State responds requesting an appointment be made within next 2 weeks and keep it with conditions imposed on defendant.  Failure to do so would/could result in in-patient evaluation.  Attorney Sacra understands and agrees with State to get the appointment made and evaluation completed.  Court directs medical history sealed in court file.  Directs competency evaluation be reset and completed by October 2, 2015.  If failure to do so, court will consider more restrictive to get the evaluation completed.  Status hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Gregory W. Sacra in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advises of letter from Department.  All parties have received.  Attorney Sacra gives status.  Messages received from defendant's wife re: health issues of defendant.  Attorney Sacra also advises he has not had contact with defendant since last court proceeding in Br. 1.  Defendant has not been available for evaluation due to emergency visits.  Court questions Attorney Sacra on verification of medical documentation from defendant.  Attorney Sacra advises he has recently requested medical documentation.  State goes through criminal complaint.  Court considers medical needs of defendant and request parties receive date for status hearing the week of Sept. 8.  Medical information to be provided by Attorney Sacra.  Absent any medical information, court may consider a warrant.

Attorney Gregory W. Sacra in court.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Sacra states evaluations re: competency hasn't taken place yet.  Requests more time for that to happen.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Richard J. Kendall in court with attorney Gregory W. Sacra.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Sacra addresses competency and request DHS do an evaluation.  State agrees.  Order to be sent by COC to DHS.  Attorney Sacra request status hearing 30 days out.  State return date 30 days out.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Gregory W. Sacra in court.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Sacra waives reading of complaint.  File set for return date. Another case pending in Sauk County.   Two weeks for signed authorization.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
